yaml.title: CoPhil EO AI/ML Training
yaml.subtitle: 4-Day Advanced Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation

markdown.markdown:
::: {.hero} ### 4-Day Advanced Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation Advanced training for Philippine EO professionals on AI/ML applications for Disaster Risk Reduction, Climate Change Adaptation, and Natural Resource Management ::: ## About This Training Welcome to the **4-Day Advanced Online Training on AI/ML for Earth Observation** for Philippine EO Professionals. This comprehensive training is part of the **CoPhil Programme** (EU-Philippines Copernicus Capacity Support Programme), a flagship initiative under the European Union's Global Gateway strategy. ::: {.callout-note} ## Training Details **Dates:** October 20-23, 2025 **Instructor:** Stylianos Kotsopoulos **Programme:** EU-Philippines CoPhil Programme This course strengthens the Philippines' capacity to use Copernicus Earth Observation data for: - **Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR)** - Flood mapping, typhoon monitoring, landslide assessment - **Climate Change Adaptation (CCA)** - Drought monitoring, agricultural resilience, coastal changes - **Natural Resource Management (NRM)** - Forest monitoring, land cover mapping, marine resources ::: ## Course Curriculum This intensive 4-day program takes you from EO data fundamentals to deploying operational AI/ML solutions. Each day builds on previous concepts through hands-on exercises using Philippine case studies. **Format:** 4 days √ó 4 sessions √ó 2 hours = 32 hours total | **Mode:** Online via Google Colab | **Level:** Intermediate to Advanced ### Learning Journey ```{mermaid} %%| fig-width: 10 %%| fig-align: center graph LR A[Day 1
EO Data &
Fundamentals] --> B[Day 2
Machine
Learning] B --> C[Day 3
Deep
Learning] C --> D[Day 4
Advanced
Topics] style A fill:#003399,stroke:#003399,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff style B fill:#f8f9fa,stroke:#dee2e6,stroke-width:2px,color:#495057 style C fill:#f8f9fa,stroke:#dee2e6,stroke-width:2px,color:#495057 style D fill:#f8f9fa,stroke:#dee2e6,stroke-width:2px,color:#495057 ``` ### What You'll Achieve By completing this training, you will: ::: {.learning-objectives} **üéØ Master EO Data** - Work confidently with Sentinel-1 SAR and Sentinel-2 optical data, understanding their characteristics and Philippine EO infrastructure (SIYASAT, NAMRIA, DOST-ASTI). Navigate the Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem and implement preprocessing pipelines. **ü§ñ Build AI/ML Models** - Design, train, and evaluate machine learning (Random Forest, SVM) and deep learning models (CNNs, U-Net, YOLO) for land cover classification, flood mapping, and disaster monitoring. Master model validation, hyperparameter tuning, and deployment workflows. **üöÄ Deploy Solutions** - Create scalable processing pipelines using cloud platforms and integrate with Philippine operational systems. Implement real-time monitoring solutions for DRR, CCA, and NRM applications. **üåè Apply to Real Challenges** - Complete hands-on projects addressing Philippine environmental priorities using real datasets from Palawan (land cover), Central Luzon (flood mapping), Mindanao (drought monitoring), and Metro Manila (urban monitoring). ::: ### Daily Breakdown ::: {.curriculum-timeline} ::: {.day-section}
01

EO Data & AI/ML Fundamentals

4 sessions √ó 2 hours
**What you'll learn:** Copernicus Sentinel missions ‚Ä¢ Philippine EO ecosystem (PhilSA, DOST-ASTI, NAMRIA) ‚Ä¢ AI/ML core concepts ‚Ä¢ Python geospatial libraries (GeoPandas, Rasterio) ‚Ä¢ Google Earth Engine **Hands-on practice:** Python geospatial data processing, GEE data access, visualization workflows [Start Day 1 ‚Üí](day1/index.qmd){.btn .btn-primary}
::: ::: {.day-section}
02

Machine Learning for EO

4 sessions √ó 2 hours
**What you'll learn:** Random Forest & SVM classification ‚Ä¢ K-means clustering ‚Ä¢ Feature engineering for spectral indices ‚Ä¢ CNN fundamentals ‚Ä¢ Transfer learning concepts **Hands-on practice:** Palawan land cover classification, model evaluation, feature importance analysis [Start Day 2 ‚Üí](day2/index.qmd){.btn .btn-primary}
::: ::: {.day-section}
03

Deep Learning for EO

4 sessions √ó 2 hours
**What you'll learn:** U-Net semantic segmentation ‚Ä¢ Object detection (YOLO, Faster R-CNN) ‚Ä¢ SAR flood mapping (Central Luzon) ‚Ä¢ Building detection & damage assessment ‚Ä¢ Transfer learning strategies **Hands-on practice:** U-Net flood mapping implementation, YOLO building detection, model fine-tuning [Start Day 3 ‚Üí](day3/index.qmd){.btn .btn-primary}
::: ::: {.day-section}
04

Advanced Topics & Projects

4 sessions √ó 2 hours
**What you'll learn:** LSTMs for time series ‚Ä¢ Drought monitoring (Mindanao) ‚Ä¢ Foundation models (NASA-IBM Prithvi, Clay) ‚Ä¢ Self-supervised learning ‚Ä¢ Explainable AI (XAI) **Hands-on practice:** Time series forecasting, foundation model fine-tuning, capstone project development [Start Day 4 ‚Üí](day4/index.qmd){.btn .btn-primary}
::: ::: ## Prerequisites Get ready for the training with these simple requirements: ::: {.prereq-container} ::: {.prereq-section .prereq-required}

Required

**Technical Setup:** - Google account (for Colab and Earth Engine) - [Google Earth Engine account](https://earthengine.google.com) (free signup) - Basic Python knowledge (variables, loops, functions) - Modern web browser (Chrome or Firefox) ::: {.callout-tip collapse="false"} ## No Installation Needed! All exercises run in Google Colaboratory. No local software installation required. :::
::: ::: {.prereq-section .prereq-recommended}

Recommended Background

**Helpful Knowledge:** - Basic remote sensing concepts (bands, resolution, sensors) - Familiarity with machine learning terminology - Understanding of Philippine geography and environmental challenges - Experience with Jupyter notebooks (helpful but not required) ::: {.callout-note collapse="false"} ## New to EO or ML? Don't worry! Day 1 covers all foundational concepts. We start from the basics. :::
::: :::

Ready to get started? Follow our step-by-step setup guide to prepare your environment.

[Complete Setup Guide ‚Üí](resources/setup.qmd){.btn .btn-primary .btn-lg}
## Course Resources Everything you need for a successful learning experience: ::: {.feature-grid} ::: {.resource-card} ### Setup Guide Complete technical setup instructions for Google Colab, Earth Engine, and required accounts. [View Guide ‚Üí](resources/setup.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm} ::: ::: {.resource-card} ### Philippine EO Resources Directory of Philippine EO platforms, agencies, and data access portals. [Explore Resources ‚Üí](resources/philippine-eo.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm} ::: ::: {.resource-card} ### Download Materials Access all course notebooks, datasets, presentations, and supplementary materials. [Download ‚Üí](resources/downloads.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm} ::: ::: {.resource-card} ### FAQ Common questions and troubleshooting tips for technical issues and course content. [Browse FAQ ‚Üí](resources/faq.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm} ::: ::: {.resource-card} ### Glossary Comprehensive definitions of EO, AI/ML, and geospatial terminology used throughout the course. [View Glossary ‚Üí](resources/glossary.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm} ::: ::: {.resource-card} ### Cheat Sheets Quick reference guides for Python, geospatial libraries, and machine learning workflows. [Get Cheat Sheets ‚Üí](resources/cheatsheets.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm} ::: ::: ## About CoPhil Programme ::: {.callout-tip} ## Technical Assistance for Philippines' Copernicus Capacity Support The **CoPhil Programme** is part of the EU-Philippines cooperation programme and the EU's Global Gateway strategy. **Key Partners:** - **Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA)** - Co-chair and space data authority - **Department of Science and Technology (DOST)** - Co-chair and technology advancement - **European Union** - Funding and technical cooperation - **European Space Agency (ESA)** - Copernicus programme expertise **Programme Objectives:** - Establish Copernicus Mirror Site in the Philippines - Build capacity in EO data analysis and AI/ML applications - Co-develop pilot services for DRR, CCA, and NRM - Create sustainable Digital Space Campus for continued learning - Foster Philippine EO community of practice ::: ## Course Delivery ::: {.callout-note} ## Training Format - **Language:** English - **Certificate:** Issued upon completion of all days and capstone project - **Support:** Live instructors, teaching assistants, and community forum ::: ## Getting Started ::: {.callout-important} ## Ready to Begin? 1. **Complete Setup** - Follow our [Setup Guide](resources/setup.qmd) 2. **Review Prerequisites** - Ensure you have the required accounts 3. **Start Day 1** - Begin with foundational concepts 4. **Ask Questions** - Use FAQ and instructor support throughout [Start with Setup Guide ‚Üí](resources/setup.qmd){.btn .btn-primary} [Jump to Day 1 ‚Üí](day1/index.qmd){.btn .btn-outline-primary} ::: ## Need Help? Throughout the training, you can: - Ask questions during live sessions - Consult the [FAQ](resources/faq.qmd) for common issues - Check the [Glossary](resources/glossary.qmd) for term definitions - Download [Cheat Sheets](resources/cheatsheets.qmd) for quick reference - Access the [Philippine EO Resources](resources/philippine-eo.qmd) directory - Contact instructors or teaching assistants ## Technical Support ::: {.callout-note} ## Getting Help For technical issues: - **Google Colab problems:** See [Setup Guide](resources/setup.qmd) - **Data access issues:** Check session-specific troubleshooting - **Course questions:** Contact instructors during sessions - **Email support:** info@philsa.gov.ph ::: ## Acknowledgments This training is made possible through the partnership between: - European Union (Global Gateway Initiative) - Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA) - Department of Science and Technology (DOST) - European Space Agency (ESA) - CoPhil Programme Consortium --- *Funded by the European Union under the Global Gateway initiative and delivered in partnership with the Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA) and the Department of Science and Technology (DOST).*
